Norma McCorvey, the original Roe of Roe v. Wade has changed her views on abortion. Do you think she had a legitimate cause for challenging the original court ruling on abortion from 1973?
 
 http://www.cnn.com/2004/LAW/09/14/roe.v.wade/
 
 Here is the website of her pro-life ministry:
 
 http://www.crossingoverministry.org/

post_info.post_title: Do you know Norma McCorvey? (aka Roe)

I know people who know her and they think she's a lesbian nutcase. I have to give her credit for recognizing her sexual orientation if she still thinks she's a lesbian.
The Doe in Doe vs Bolten is also pro-life
I already said she was a nutcase.

I already said she was a nutcase.

 
 lol you know the Doe in Doe vs Bolten too... :-/ right.

"Do you think she had a legitimate cause for challenging the original court ruling on abortion from 1973?"

 
 I don't think her case alone is legitimate. 
 The grounds for criminalizing abortion were just as shaky as the constitutional grounds used to legalize it. It may only be a matter of time until something reinforces it. 
 Yeah, good ol' Norma hasn't been the same since she converted. She is kind of whacky. Perhaps she is really a double agent trying to infiltrate and discredit the pro-life movement by saying some real off the wall stuff. 
 
 "I personally think it's the pro-abortion people who are doing this to collect on their insurance, so they can go out and build bigger and better killing centers." - Norma McCorvey (aka Jane Roe) tells CNN that violent acts like clinic bombings are the work of the Pro-Choice forces
 
 Not to mention she has raided an abortion clinic...but only to collect dead fetuses. She didn't go for the register.
